uk.ac.imperial.vazels.reef.client
Class AddressResolution

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.imperial.vazels.reef.client.AddressResolution

public class AddressResolution
extends java.lang.Object

Used for an easy way to resolve addresses on either the proxy or our server.

The SOP will block requests from our front end (during testing only) to our back end, as they are on different addresses. As a workaround, we use a proxy server to route the request properly during testing. This class will deal with choosing where to send our requests so long as we set the testing variable properly.

See Also:
Same Origin Policy

Field Detail

baseURL

public java.lang.String baseURL

testing

public static final boolean testing
Edit this whenever we move between testing and deployment!

This should be true whenever we are in testing or false otherwise. It tells the class whether to route a request through our proxy or not.

Method Detail

resolve

public java.lang.String resolve(java.lang.String url)
Gives a correct address to request from.

For instance if we want to request "/settings/", we want one of:

  • "http://localhost:8000/settings/" - in deployment
  • "http://localhost:8999/proxy/settings/" - in testing

    • Parameters:
    url - The relative address (e.g. "/settings/")
    Returns:
    The actual address to call (e.g. "http://localhost:8000/settings/")
